arm_group.description: Pregnant women assigned to have vaginal coitus at least twice a week
Pregnant women assigned to have no vaginal intercourse

brief_summary.textblock:
Vaginal intercourse to promote labour onset is biologically plausible. Oxytocin release
      during female orgasm, cervix mechanical stimulation and the effect of semen's prostaglandins
      are possible involved mechanisms. The investigators propose to evaluate the effect of
      vaginal intercourse on spontaneous labour at term.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Vaginal Intercourse on Spontaneous Labour at Term

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Term pregnancy

          -  Singleton pregnancy

          -  Cephalic presentation

          -  No previous cesarean section

          -  Irrelevant obstetric history

          -  Surveiled pregnancy without complications

study_pop.textblock: Pregnant women attending to antenatal appointment in our Obstetric Unit

intervention.description: vaginal intercourse at least twice a week

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Vaginal Intercourse on Spontaneous Labour at Term- A Randomized Trial

oversight_info.authority: Portugal: Hospital de Santa Maria Ethics Committee

primary_outcome.description: Spontaneous labour was considered to be established when there were regular contractions and at least 3cm of cervical dilation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Spontaneous labour onset between 37 and 42 weeks of pregnancy

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Gestational age at delivery (between 37 and 42 weeks of pregnancy)

secondary_outcome.description: Route of delivery - vaginally or cesarean
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Mode of delivery (vaginal or cesarean delivery) up to 42 weeks of pregnancy

secondary_outcome.description: number of days between patients study recruitment and delivery (patients were included in the study at 38 weeks of pregnancy and followed until delivery; if spontaneous labour did not occur labour induction was scheduled during the 41th week of pregnancy)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: number of days between patients study recruitment and delivery (maximum period of 28 days - between 38 and 41/0-6 weeks/days of pregnancy)

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Prospective
